comment: This is a page from an ancient Chinese dictionary or character compendium, likely a version of the *Shuowen Jiezi* or similar work. The layout includes large characters in seal script (篆书) on the left side of each entry, with smaller regular script (楷书) explanations to their right. Each entry provides etymological analysis, including components (e.g., '从金', meaning 'from metal'), phonetic indicators ('聲'), and definitions. The page number '小四百○二' (small 402) appears at the top right, along with the title '說文古本' (Ancient Edition of Shuowen). The name '李明' is visible at the bottom right, possibly indicating the publisher or editor.
